reviews.sentence: Excellent service large comfortable room. My husband and I stayed at Hotel Rouge in Washington DC for 2 nights while visiting the city. The location is near Dupont Circle as well as close to the monuments. The hotel is a bit hard to find our GPS guided us to the wrong place so maybe use the hotels directions instead. If you drive a red car you get one night of free parking. Check in was a breeze and they upgraded our room for free. We had over 450 square feet of space in Washington DC. that is usually unheard of. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had plenty of room to spread out. There was a cute little alcove that had a comfy sofa on one end of the room and the other end of the room was covered in windows and there were two chairs that we found to be very comfortable. Our view was of the Australian embassy and the Christmas lights up and down the street were beautiful. If you are a Kimpton Karma Rewards member you automatically get 10 off the in room bar or the bar downstairs Bar Rouge you also get free WiFi. The drinks in the bar are creative and interesting. One night we pigged out on hot wings and fries with truffle oil. Yum. Every night at the hotel between 5 and 6 pm there is a wine hour with complimentary wine and nibbles. A great way to start off the evening before going out to dinner. The neighborhood was very safe and valet parking was easy just give them some time to get your car for you so call the front desk ahead of time before checking out. The great thing about this hotel is that they honor requests. We asked for a very quiet room and we got it. Sleep quality was great and the staff was incredibly professional and welcoming thanks Kiah. We had a great time and have a new favorite hotel in Washington DC. We will return.

there is a red for everyone. Decor fabulous love a bit of red. Also very friendly helpful staff. Location close to local shops and restaurants. We had an adjoining room not requested or advised by reception when checking in was not bothered until could hear neighbours TV from 430 in the morning. Otherwise fab.

Amazing customer service under the pressure of being understaffed. The staff was excellent. Very well trained in customer service. The hotel was quiet shower and other amenities were decent. The cocktail hour with wine was great. Given it was the weekend of the inauguration and womens march there should have been more staff working in the restaurant. The poor woman working the bar and the cook had no one to help them no planning. Another woman came out and helped with the meals. They all kept their cool under pressure but staffing could have been planned better.

2 Night Visit During Womens March on Washington. Our room was wonderfully large well designed and comfortable. The furnishings were all in great condition and the staff attentive. Each evening featured a small free happy hour in the lobby with wine and one appetizer. We did miss having a coffee maker in the room although coffee was provided every morning in the lobby. The hotel did try to charge us 20 day for coffee and internet without even verifying that we used either so be aware at check out. Politely ask them to remove the charge and they should. Location style service large and comfortable rooms. It was difficult to figure out how to use the TV remote even for our milenials.

Amazing. We arrived on Tuesday afternoon to a more then welcoming staff and wine hour 5 6 and well needed. The staff on the checkout Mariene sorry if i spelt it wrong and the other lady on reception at the time sorry did not get your name were very welcoming and attentive and swiftly had us checked in and up to our room 907. Once checked in went for a walk and some food and arrived to a gift a really great start to our honeymoon. The room was spacious and welcoming lit mainly by lamps the king bed was firm and comfortable and accommodated us well especially as I am 63 and my feet were not out of the end. Our room was cleaned each day and always felt fresh when you walked in. Our stay there was great friendly staff everywhere always willing to help. Ask for the metro card great for Arlington cemetery the pentagon tour and then the north of the Jefferson memorial all on the blue line if you plan on using it as they may have credit on or not but means you do not have to pay for the card and then just return them when you are done. A really nice touch. It is close to a bike share left out of the hotel and around the corner from the Australian embassy. Using the big bus tour map available at reception we planned out all out where the bike stops were as you have 30 mins free then the charges kick in. 8 for 24 hour access and if planned properly that is the only cost. Throughout our stay we felt very welcome and loved every minute in the hotel. Nothing was too much getting us a kettle to have tea a sowing kit or anything else including take out menus. If you are sight seeing it is a great place to stay as it is a straight walk down to the White House and the national monument from there you can see the Lincoln memorial and the capital building. It is all walkable but we suggest maybe using the bikes as well just to save your fetThere is restaurants bars and shops all within walking distance either on 17th or going he other way to 15th and 14th so the location is great. With Farragut north and west metros no more then a 10 minute walk away. A truly great start to our honeymoon in a fantastic hotel and amazing city. We will be back one day as we still need to go to the White House. Thank you.

Centrally located. Surprisingly quiet. did not really order room service. The front desk staff were very nice and attentive. Modern furniture decor and clean spacious rooms. Red is definitely the theme. Restaurants everywhere within walking distance ❣.

Lovely but very noisy heater. Room was very lush very comfy beds massive mirror lush bathroom big TV and sofa and foot rest I had a couple of issues which was the heater which made so much noise and kept waking me up through the night and there was no lights apart from lamps which made the room very dim room service was very expensive too I would recommend to just go downstairs into the bar unles you want to spend 50 dollars.
I would definitely come back next time I am in DC. Great location youthful vibe friendly staff loved the breakfast options room itself was spacious and comfortable. Superb value for money.
Great location metro lots of restaurants whole foods are within walking distance. Small hotel with spacious rooms.

Great location and funky hotel. We took advantage of the special 3rd day free this October. I had heard about Kimptons but never stayed. This one was certainly rouge red but in a fun way. Our handicap accessible roll in shower room was large with a good layout. Even if not needed for handicapped it was a great room on 8th floor. Bed is very comfortable all linens etc are lovely. My only negative comment is that is needs a bit of a freshening. it seems a bit worn. Although it was clean and comfortable I felt it seemed well worn which is not surprising for location in DC. Walking distance to Dupont Circle museums restaurants public transportation. Staff is friendly and helpful.

It was not a friendly place to stay. The location was adequate to our planned activities. The elevator was slow. The staff was lazy and not friendly. The television was not working properly terrible signals and not HD. The breakfast was greasy and the waiter hostile. The restaurant bar was closed most of the time we were there. The bathroom was not properly cleaned.

It was okay could have been better for the price. I liked the closeness to everything. I like that I was not bothered. The breakfast was a little skimpy and the room was very warm despite being 65 on the thermostat. The television options were very old school.

LOVED it and will definitely come back. The STAFF is exceptional. They are polite kind and always willing to go the extra mile to make sure your stay is wonderful. Maybe add a bit of protein to breakfast. Even if only a choice of protein bars.
Exceptional. could have had fruit with free breakfast.
Good location. Overall good service all around. For breakfast that is supposed to be free we did extablish that the free excludes any cooked breakfast which nobody really tells you about it.
Exceptional. Room is spacious and well decorated location is amazing. There is whole food 2 blocks from here. Selection of breakfast is limited.
Disappointing. LocationOutdated expensive cold terrible breakfast.

Charming Hotel. Minus the Parking. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. My daughters and I visited for the Fall 2019 Howard University Open House event and wanted to stay nearby the campus. We enjoyed our spacious room and good customer service. I would recommend that they improve their continental breakfast. The bagels toast were too hard. Also we paid 100 to park 49 parking fee parking tax service fee plus service tax. Very expensive. Also our room did not have updated cell phone charging ports. Luckily I brought my wall plug in charger. We also did not face any facial towels in our room but a quick call to housekeeping rectified the problem.

I have been staying at Kimpton Hotels for years. But it seems like things have gone downhill since they were bought by IHG. My stay this week at the Rouge in DC was a disappointment. I will be looking for a better alternative. My first night the heating ac unit was making a horrible cranking noise off and on all night. I hardly slept. When I left the hotel in the morning I asked that it be attended to. When I got back to my room this afternoon it was making the noise. I called again and asked for help and the guy came and said I needed to keep the fan on medium or high — that it only made the noise when the fan was on low. That worked about 2 hours but horrible noise has started up again. Also I had to call for help to get the TV to work due to some jicky issue with the remote. I ordered room service for dinner — food came but no wine as requested. Wine finally did come but when I went to the bar at 930 to get another glass they told me bar was closed due to a private party. No sign posted no notice to hotel guests. I know that sometimes restaurants close for parties. But restaurants bars in hotels with paying guests.
pleasant but will not come back. Rooms are nice. Bar and breakfast are a joke.
